intro: Lavauxia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Lavauxia triloba is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with three distinct lobes.
